pullRequest.body:
This removes unnecessary `IsScalarTower R A A` and `SMulCommClass R A A` arguments from `LinearMap.mulLeft` and `LinearMap.mulRight`, respectively.

As described in the new docstring, this allows respective specializations to `R := A·µê·µí·µñ` and `R := A`.

Unfortunately all of the lemmas have to be reordered to take advantage of these relaxed assumptions.

In the chaos, a few lemmas also became generalized to non-unital rings.

There is some overlap here with `DistribMulAction.toLinearMap`, but that doesn't work in the case of non-unital rings.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/0c506a3e-50e9-470c-b8c1-44c44d61e806) for commit 06fbed383ee2ee0a96ea76c31f006d665f4f5d89.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/a048a4a5-68e3-4a05-8f68-6dcf0dd56129/to/0c506a3e-50e9-470c-b8c1-44c44d61e806) against commit 436211744e3cfc6ceefe33edf3f22adf4fce6aff:
```diff
  Benchmark                             Metric         Change
  ===========================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.PiTensorProduct   instructions    13.9%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+24.652‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.01%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.PiTensorProduct`|+11.307‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+13.85%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.TensorProduct.Basic`|+9.94‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.84%)|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Graded.Internal`|+3.145‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.22%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Bilinear`|+2.906‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+16.49%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions -2.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Even`|-1.319‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-1.26%)|
|`Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.EvenEquiv`|-1.351‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-1.02%)|
</details>

@eric-wieser this looks pretty reasonable aside from the slowdown, which is admittedly pretty minimal. Do you think you could try taking a look at `PiTensorProduct` though? Especially the one declaration in the file that has an intersection with the diff, as that's likely the culprit.

If you can't find the slowdown it's not a big deal, but we might as well have a short look.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/860d538e-e38b-43f9-af31-4946f5906183) for commit 95292e5ecececb75822d260cb1be6d428d3ba2c1.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/a048a4a5-68e3-4a05-8f68-6dcf0dd56129/to/860d538e-e38b-43f9-af31-4946f5906183) against commit 436211744e3cfc6ceefe33edf3f22adf4fce6aff.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: eric-wieser can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.
